page.title: 06CALOW C.E.JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: Calow Junior School is still a Church of England Controlled School. The church is St.Peters.The old school was built across the road from the church because the Vicar was the Head. The Rector comes into school every week and takes Assembly.He then spends about an hour talking to one class.We visit the church on special occasions. We have our Carol Service there and some of us go to the Christingle Service,which is in aid of the Church of England Childrens Society. Just before Easter two ladies from the church come into school and we help to make the Palm Crosses for the Palm Sunday Services.We have a special Palm Cross Service too The Rector visits school at other times and we visit the church too.
